intro: Scepocarpus mannii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody vines and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by distinctive, elongated fruits that turn yellow or orange when mature. Its botanical features include a unique leaf morphology with trifoliate or pinnate arrangements and the presence of calcium oxalate crystals in its tissues. Scepocarpus mannii is often found in humid, lowland rainforest environments.
